docs.lead_paragraph: The most vulnerable suffer when technology contracts are bungled.

headline.main: An Error Message for the Poor
headline.print_headline: An Error Message For the Poor

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof David A Super holds the poor remain the most vulnerable to lapses in government computer systems, citing examples related to Medicaid and food stamps; urges Pres Obama to address these problems with same urgency he lent to fixing the government health care website.
docs.snippet: The most vulnerable suffer when technology contracts are bungled.

docs.lead_paragraph: A surge in anti-abortion measures in more than half the states has made it far more difficult in many regions to obtain the procedure.

headline.main: Access to Abortion Falling as States Pass Restrictions
headline.print_headline: Access to Abortion Falling As States Pass Restrictions

docs.abstract: Three-year surge in anti-abortion measures in more than half of all states has altered the landscape for abortion access, shutting some clinics, threatening others and making it far more difficult in many regions to obtain the procedure; advocates for both sides are preparing for new political campaigns and court battles that could redefine the constitutional limits for curbing the right to abortion set by the 1973 Roe v Wade decision.
docs.snippet: A surge in anti-abortion measures in more than half the states has made it far more difficult in many regions to obtain the procedure.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department said the requirements for birth control coverage did not impose a “substantial burden” on an order of Roman Catholic nuns who challenged them.

headline.main: Justices Are Asked to Reject Nuns’ Challenge to Health Law
headline.print_headline: Justices Are Asked to Reject Nuns’ Challenge to Health Law

docs.abstract: Obama administration urges Supreme Court to reject lawsuit filed by the Little Sisters of the Poor, order of Roman Catholic nuns challenging requirements for many employers to provide health insurance coverage for birth control or face penalties under new health care law; Justice Dept says requirements do not impose 'substantial burden' on nuns’ exercise of religion because they can 'opt out' of the obligation.
docs.snippet: The Justice Department said the requirements for birth control coverage did not impose a “substantial burden” on an order of Roman Catholic nuns who challenged them.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.print_headline: Actions Seek To Further Gun Control

docs.abstract: Two new executive actions will make it easier for states to provide information about mentally ill individuals to the federal background check system.
docs.snippet: Two new executive actions will make it easier for states to provide information about mentally ill individuals to the federal background check system.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Friday proposed two new gun control regulations aimed at clarifying restrictions on gun ownership for the mentally ill and strengthening a database used for background checks before firearm purchases.

headline.main: Obama Directs New Gun Background Check Measures
headline.print_headline: Obama Directs New Gun Background Check Measures

docs.snippet: The Obama administration on Friday proposed two new gun control regulations aimed at clarifying restrictions on gun ownership for the mentally ill and strengthening a database used for background checks before firearm purchases.

docs.lead_paragraph: Texas has seen the future of the public library, and it looks a lot like an Apple Store: Rows of glossy iMacs beckon. iPads mounted on a tangerine-colored bar invite readers. And hundreds of other tablets stand ready for checkout to anyone with a borrowing card.

docs.lead_paragraph: For working people making modest wages and struggling with high medical bills from chronic disease, President Barack Obama's health care plan sounds like long-awaited relief. But the promise could go unfulfilled.

headline.main: Skimpy Health Law Plans Leave Some 'Underinsured'
headline.print_headline: Skimpy Health Law Plans Leave Some 'Underinsured'

docs.snippet: For working people making modest wages and struggling with high medical bills from chronic disease, President Barack Obama's health care plan sounds like long-awaited relief. But the promise could go unfulfilled.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government asked the Supreme Court on Friday not to allow Roman Catholic-affiliated groups a temporary exemption from a part of the Obamacare healthcare law that requires employers to provide insurance policies covering contraception.

headline.main: U.S. Asks Top Court Not to Extend Catholics' Contraception Exemption
headline.print_headline: U.S. Asks Top Court Not to Extend Catholics' Contraception Exemption

docs.snippet: The U.S. government asked the Supreme Court on Friday not to allow Roman Catholic-affiliated groups a temporary exemption from a part of the Obamacare healthcare law that requires employers to provide insurance policies covering contraception.

docs.lead_paragraph: You were patient with the government's kooky website, and now you have your health insurance card. That's good, since your family is expecting a new baby.

headline.main: Medicare Advantage and the 'Theft' of $156 Billion

docs.abstract: Changes to payments to Medicare Advantage plans introduced by the Affordable Care Act are more equitable for all taxpayers, an economist writes.
